result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Cox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark A Cox is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark A Cox was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Mark A Cox was found guilty of Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any unsupervised contact, direct or indirect, with NJLC, DRM & DEM without written permission of PO agent.
Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:40
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Murali Sreenivasurao Jasti.  Rachel E Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Status conference on May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not have any contact with N.J.L.C. (identified in Complaint as N.J.D.), D.R.M., or D.E.M. unless it is supervised by a responsible adult.
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle with any amount of controlled substances in his system.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 12
